Validate when DVR enabled, l2_pop is also enabled

The agent should fail to start when
enable_distributed_routing = True and l2_population = False
otherwise the router won't behave as expected.

All the cross subnet traffic (between VMs of the same tenant)
in DVR is now handled locally on the compute node using the router namespace.
A Linux namespace is created for every virtual router,
on each compute node that hosts VMs that are connected to that router.

The local DVR performs the routing and replaces the source MAC address and
the destination MAC address for every packet leaving the compute node.
In order to do that correctly, the router must be populated with
all the L2 addresses of the attached networks

subject: Fix SAN generic driver ssh whitespaced commands
commit_message:
Fix SAN generic driver ssh whitespaced commands

SAN driver was sending commands over ssh with whitespaces between
every character resulting in commands like "u n a m e - s" instead
of "uname -s" (example from bug report).

As the bug reporter noted, the problem was that there were two joins
in the process of mounting the command. The first one got the
tuple and joined into a string. The second one joined a whitespace
between each character of the string.

Additionally, this behavior made utils.ssh_injection a bad check,
because it expected a list of args used in 'for arg in cmd_list' and
what it got was a single string. This resulted in the check being made
over the single characters instead of each arg.

All this is to explain why I chose to remove the first join instead of
the second one.

An unit test for this issue was created. SAN driver had no unit test.

Change-Id: I8e8624f2b82c26522936adf05e637a7bbe34a069
Closes-Bug: #1422604

commit_message:
Remove warnings from openstack responses

Puppet's `commands` and `has_command` methods are not able to separate
stdout and stderr. When the openstack command prints out unexpected
warnings that have no bearing on our computation, we need to ignore it,
otherwise the CSV module will fail to parse it. This patch filters the
total response produced by the openstack command into only lines that
match a CSV-like regular expression with at least two fields.

If a legitimate error is produced that causes the command to return
failure, puppet catches it during the command execution and raises a
Puppet::Execution error, so this change will not affect its ability to
detect legitimate failures and report on them.

subject: Custom Horizon Theme
commit_message:
Custom Horizon Theme

This patch is to propose the workflow of customizing Horizon theme
easily.

Currently Horizon relies on DjangoScssFilter to preprocess all the scss
files. The css styles such as color and font are mostly controlled by
the variables specified in the the scss files (_variables.scss). In
addition, Horizon mostly reuses bootstrap sass variables to define the
styles.

We leverage the current idea by injecting another level of variables to
overwrite the current bootstrap/horizon variables such that developer
can swap the theme easily.

This patch includes several areas of code changes:

1. Introduce another static file subdirectory for developer to store
   custom themes.
2. Add an additional configuration in the settings.py for developer to
   load the theme to use.
3. Add an example new custom theme.
4. Refactor the current Horizon sass files such that they don't hardcode
   the style but are controlled by the variables instead.

Implements: blueprint horizon-themes

Change-Id: Id915b95b66d9aba97cdb41cc100bf7dc1d75afcd
Co-Authored-By: Alan Fung <wingfung@cisco.com>

subject: WIP Fail to a different redis master when using sentinel
commit_message:
WIP Fail to a different redis master when using sentinel

It's been discovered that there was no code in tooz to fail to a
different master server when using a redis setup that has one more
sentinels. To get a different master, a new client needs to be
created (by asking the sentinels for the current master).

The code in this changeset provides a proof of concept of a way of
doing this that has been demonstrated to work in manual testing. It
feels, however, to be both dirty and incomplete.

The hope is that in the process of reviewing this we can come up
with a cleaner solution.

The fundamental principle being acted upon here is that if we get a
ToozConnectionError while trying to get_members, then attempt to
_start the redis client again. This will call _make_client, querying
the sentinels for the current master.

This code only does the _start during get_members but it could be
turned on for other RedisFutureResult callers by passing a reference
to self as 'client'. There's also commented code for doing a _start
when there is a failed heartbeat.

This particular implementation is fairly closely tied to the needs
of ceilometer group membership partitioning so may not be sufficient
for general uses.

subject: Make the 3PAR drivers honor the pool in create
commit_message:
Make the 3PAR drivers honor the pool in create

Currently, the 3PAR drivers rely on the pool (CPG) existing
in the extra specs of a volume type.   This is the way that the
3PAR drivers supported the idea of 'pools' prior to Cinder
itself supporting pools.

Now, the 3PAR drivers will not use the CPG specified in the
extra specs of a volume type.   The drivers will log a warning
explaining that CPG is deprecated, and then override the CPG
setting with the pool name specified by the scheduler in the
volume['host'] entry.    This fixes a few bugs in the 3PAR
drivers.

Existing 3PAR deployments will need to update their cinder.conf
to specify the list of CPGs they want the driver to support as
pools in the hp3par_cpg=[list of cpgs] entry.  hp3par_cpg can be
a single CPG, or a comma separated list of CPGS.

The 3PAR best practice guide will be updated for the Kilo release
explaining how to upgrade from existing deployments and describe
how best to use CPGS as pools.

Closes-Bug: #1432876

into an image from the environment during a full devtest.sh run.

and there is no way to differentiate which image a variable in the user
environment should apply to when running devtest, as the same variable
would be used in each execution of diskimage-builder during the run.

element variables from image-specific prefixes, thus allowing the user

subject: VMware: Fix disk UUID in instance's extra config
commit_message:
VMware: Fix disk UUID in instance's extra config

During volume attach, the UUID of volume's virtual disk
is saved in instance's extra config. The virtual disk is
searched by volume's UUID assuming that the disk name
contains volume's UUID. But this assumption may not be
true always. Once the instance is migrated with an attached
volume, the volume's vmdk name changes after volume detach.
This patch fixes the problem by using the disk device info
of volume instead of searching the virtual disk by volume
UUID.
